outline:
1. to sojourn, abide, dwell in, dwell with, remain, inhabit, be a stranger, be continuing, surely
    1. (Qal)
      1. to sojourn, dwell for a time
      2. to abide, stay, temporarily dwell
    2. (Hithpolel)
      1. to seek hospitality with
      2. to assemble oneself
    3. to stir up trouble, strife, quarrel, gather together
      1. (Qal)
        1. to stir up strife
        2. to quarrel
      2. (Hithpolel) to excite oneself
    4. to dread, fear, stand in awe, be afraid
      1. (Qal)
        1. to fear, be afraid
        2. to be in awe, stand in awe
kjv_def: abide, assemble, be afraid, dwell, fear, gather (together), inhabitant, remain, sojourn, stand in awe, (be) stranger, [idiom] surely.
strongs_def: properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid)
